org.princehouse.mica.util

Class Distribution<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<T,java.lang.Double>
        • org.princehouse.mica.util.Distribution<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> 

    public class Distribution<T>
extends java.util.HashMap<T,java.lang.Double>
    Distribution represents a probability-weighted collection of objects. In MiCA, this is almost always used with the type parameter Distribution
    to represent a set of neighbors to gossip with. The values in a Distribution should always sum to one, although this is not enforced. Methods such as normalize() and ipnormalize() can be used to bring a distribution back a sum of one. Distribution extends HashMap.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
